title: Tactic Transmit — Implement missing landing sections, admin access panel, and masterplan images

requirements.summary: Implement the empty landing section components (CircuitryPulseBackground, ProductSection, ExecutiveBoardSection, ConnectGatewaySection) as working React components consistent with the portal styling.
acceptanceCriteria: The following files are no longer empty and export working React components: frontend/src/components/landing/CircuitryPulseBackground.tsx, frontend/src/components/landing/ProductSection.tsx, frontend/src/components/landing/ExecutiveBoardSection.tsx, frontend/src/components/landing/ConnectGatewaySection.tsx.
No runtime errors occur when rendering these components in the app.
All user-facing text introduced/updated by these components is in English.

file_operations.description: Implement a non-blocking, pointer-events-none visual background layer (deep-tech circuitry/pulse aesthetic) suitable for stacking behind hero/sections; keep animation lightweight to avoid scroll/interaction degradation.

Implement a Product section that presents TT‑1 capabilities and key feature highlights, optionally reusing existing product presentation patterns (e.g., interactive cards) without introducing new routes.
Implement an Executive Board preview section (summary cards/teasers) consistent with deep-tech/glass styling and provide a clear navigation affordance to the existing /board page.
Implement a Connect gateway section that surfaces public contact/messaging actions and includes a dedicated ADMINISTRATIVE ACCESS area (label is handled in REQ-42) while preserving responsiveness.

requirements.summary: Update the Home (/ ) page composition to render the rebuilt landing sections in a coherent order, and layer CircuitryPulseBackground appropriately behind/around the Hero without performance issues.
acceptanceCriteria: The Home page at route / renders the rebuilt ProductSection and ExecutiveBoardSection in a coherent order/layout with the existing sections.
The Home page uses CircuitryPulseBackground as a non-blocking visual background layer where appropriate (e.g., behind/around the Hero) without degrading scroll/interaction performance.
No content overflows/crops on common breakpoints (mobile, tablet, desktop).

file_operations.description: Wire ProductSection, ExecutiveBoardSection, and ConnectGatewaySection into the existing landing page composition alongside the existing Hero, Welcome Narrative, Core Values, and Public Contact sections in a coherent layout order.
Layer CircuitryPulseBackground into/around the Hero as a non-blocking background (e.g., placed as an absolute layer with pointer-events-none) while keeping existing background and content readable.

requirements.summary: Add a dedicated “ADMINISTRATIVE ACCESS” login UI section using Internet Identity, navigating to /admin after sign-in, while keeping /admin protected by existing auth + admin checks.
acceptanceCriteria: A visible login panel labeled exactly “ADMINISTRATIVE ACCESS” is rendered somewhere in the public portal UI (e.g., within the Connect area or an appropriate page/section).
Clicking login triggers Internet Identity authentication.
After successful authentication, the app navigates to /admin and the Admin Dashboard loads for admin users.
Non-admin authenticated users are blocked from /admin and shown the existing access denied behavior.

file_operations.description: Create a reusable login panel component labeled exactly “ADMINISTRATIVE ACCESS” that uses Internet Identity login/logout flows and navigates to /admin after successful sign-in; use the authorization component patterns for auth/role-aware UI behavior. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Render the “ADMINISTRATIVE ACCESS” panel within the Connect gateway section so it is visible in the public portal UI; use the authorization component patterns for Internet Identity integration reminders. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Ensure unauthenticated users who attempt to access /admin are handled gracefully (keep redirect behavior) and confirm the flow works with the new ADMINISTRATIVE ACCESS panel sign-in redirect; use the authorization component guidance for clearing cached data on logout. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Add required masterplan static images under frontend/public/assets/generated and render them in the UI (poster visible, grid tile used as background) via direct /assets/generated references only.
acceptanceCriteria: The files tt1-assembly-hero-poster.dim_1920x1080.png and syncing-grid-tile.dim_512x512.png exist under frontend/public/assets/generated.
At least one page/section visibly renders the montage poster image and at least one background layer uses the grid tile pattern.
Images are referenced directly via /assets/generated/... paths from the frontend (not fetched via backend APIs).
Pages remain responsive and performant; backgrounds do not block interactions.

file_operations.description: Add the generated image asset at exactly frontend/public/assets/generated/tt1-assembly-hero-poster.dim_1920x1080.png for direct static serving from the frontend.
Add the generated image asset at exactly frontend/public/assets/generated/syncing-grid-tile.dim_512x512.png for direct static serving from the frontend.

Confirm and maintain direct usage of /assets/generated/syncing-grid-tile.dim_512x512.png as a repeating background layer and /assets/generated/tt1-assembly-hero-poster.dim_1920x1080.png as a subtle poster layer, ensuring layers remain non-blocking (pointer-events-none) and performant.

Visibly render the montage poster image (frontend/public/assets/generated/tt1-assembly-hero-poster.dim_1920x1080.png) within the Product section as a responsive image or decorative panel element, while keeping layout responsive on mobile/tablet/desktop.
